member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.PartialEvaluator
member.summary: Evaluates all of an expression's subtrees that aren't dependent on any parameters to the expression (things like local variables). This is necessary so we can turn the evaluated values into constants that we can send to the server where the query executes.
member.remarks: Note that by evaluating as much of the expression as possible now, any future re-evaluation of the query (for the purposes of paging in the MobileServiceCollectionView, etc.) will use constants rather than the latest values in closed variables, etc. This is desirable behavior for data source paging but should be carefully considered for other scenarios. - This code is based on the concepts discussed in http://blogs.msdn.com/b/mattwar/archive/2007/08/01/linq-building-an-iqueryable-provider-part-iii.aspx which is pointed to by MSDN as the reference for building LINQ providers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.PartialEvaluator.PartiallyEvaluate(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Evaluate all subtrees of an expression that aren't dependent on parameters to that expression and replace the subtree with a constant expression.
member.returns: An expression in which every node is either a constant or part of a subtree that depends on a one of the expression's parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.PartialEvaluator.FindIndependentSubtrees(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Walk the expression and compute all of the subtrees that are not dependent on any of the expressions parameters.
member.returns: A set of all the expression subtrees that are independent from the expression's parameters. Note that this set will include every element of an independent subtree, but it's not a problem because the EvaluateIndependentSubtrees walks top down.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.PartialEvaluator.EvaluateIndependentSubtrees(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression})
member.summary: Replace all the independent subtrees in an expression with constants equal to the expression's evaluated result.
member.param: The independent subtrees in the expression.
member.returns: An expression that depends only on parameter values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.VisitorHelper
member.summary: Visit all the members of specific types of expression tree nodes. This helps reduce the number of specific visitor classes we need to declare.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.VisitorHelper.visitor
member.summary: A visitor callback for the generic Visit method that takes the Expression along with a function that will recurse and returns the visited expression or a modified value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.VisitorHelper.memberVisitor
member.summary: A visitor callback for the VisitMember method that takes the MemberExpression along with a function that will recurse and returns the visisted expression or a modified value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.VisitorHelper.#ctor
member.summary: Private constructor to prevent instantiation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.VisitorHelper.VisitAll(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression,System.Func{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression,System.Func{System.Linq.Expressions.Expression,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression})
member.summary: Visit all the nodes in the expression.
member.param: A function that takes the current node and another function to recurse and returns an expression.
member.returns: The expression obtained by visiting the input expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.VisitorHelper.VisitMembers(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression,System.Func{System.Linq.Expressions.MemberExpression,System.Func{System.Linq.Expressions.MemberExpression,System.Linq.Expressions.Expression},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression})
member.summary: Visit all the member accesses in the expression.
member.param: A function that takes the current member access node and another function to recurse and returns and expression.
member.returns: The expression obtained by visiting the input expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.VisitorHelper.Visit(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression)
member.summary: Visit every node.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.VisitorHelper.VisitMember(System.Linq.Expressions.MemberExpression)
member.summary: Visit member access.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.ApplicationStorage.Microsoft#WindowsAzure#MobileServices#IApplicationStorage#TryReadSetting(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Tries to read a setting's value from application storage.
member.param: The name of the setting to try to read.
Upon returning, if the return value was true, will be the value of the given setting; will be null otherwise.
member.returns: true if the setting existed and was successfully read; false otherwise.
member.exception: Thrown if the setting name is null or whitespace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.ApplicationStorage.Microsoft#WindowsAzure#MobileServices#IApplicationStorage#WriteSetting(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Writes the setting's value to application storage.
member.param: The name of the setting to write.
member.exception: Thrown if the setting name is null or empty.
Thrown if an error occurs while writing the setting.
